![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation for PiecesOS startup issues:

**Key points:**

* Several users reported issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or failing to start completely.
* The issue seems to be more prevalent on Windows machines.
* The Pieces team identified the problem as a major data migration during the 11.1.0 update.
* A fix was implemented and released in version 11.1.1.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up
* PiecesOS failing to start completely
* Missing systray icon
* PFD unable to connect

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team migrated data from the previous stack to the new stack during the 11.1.0 update. This caused the long boot times and startup issues.
* The issue was resolved in version 11.1.1.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is resolved for most users who have updated to version 11.1.1.
* Some users may still experience the issue if they have a corrupted or incomplete database.

**Additional notes:**

* The Pieces team is also working on a patch to prevent the migration of unnecessary files and folders in the next update.
* Users who have issues with OneDrive should reach out to support or remove the database if it is empty.

**Users experiencing issues:**

* `Shamas-Habib`
* `JasonDWilson`

**Additional comments:**

* Issue appears to be more prevalent on Windows machines.
* The Pieces team is actively working on resolving the issue and improving the overall experience.

## Additional notes:
* The information is current as of November 2023, as the provided text does not contain any information beyond that date.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup Failure After Update
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to boot or launch after updating, particularly on macOS with M1 chips and on Windows. This was due to a data migration issue during the 11.1.0 update. The issue was largely resolved in version 11.1.1.  Ensuring the correct build for the architecture (Apple Silicon vs Intel) and reinstalling are recommended solutions.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (PASimmons) reported an issue with Pieces for developers not running on their M1 Mac.
* Pieces support bot automatically triaged the issue and routed it to the responsible team member.
* Support agent (mark-at-pieces) provided instructions for troubleshooting and reinstalling the correct build for the user's device.

**Problems Identified:**

* User was using an incorrect build of Pieces for developers (Intel instead of Apple Silicon) on their M1 Mac.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Support agent suggested reinstalling Pieces for developers and PiecesOS using the correct build for the user's device.
* User confirmed that reinstalling with the correct build resolved the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is resolved. The user is instructed to follow the announcement in #615 for further updates.

recommendations: **Address PiecesOS Launch Failures:** Prioritize resolving the PiecesOS launch failures related to AVX2 support and database errors, as they prevent users from accessing the platform.

**Improve Update Process:** Investigate and address the issues arising from the 11.1.0 and 11.1.1 updates, focusing on data migration, hardware compatibility, and clear communication about potential issues.

**Enhance Performance Monitoring:** Implement better monitoring and logging for Pieces Desktop App performance, allowing for quicker identification and resolution of issues like slow boot times and unresponsiveness.
**Provide Clearer Hardware Requirements:** Clearly communicate the updated hardware requirements for PiecesOS, especially regarding AVX2 support, to prevent installation and launch issues.
**Improve Model Download Reliability:** Investigate and fix the Ollama model download failures to ensure users can easily access and utilize available models.
**Gather Detailed Support Logs:** Encourage users to provide detailed support logs when reporting issues to aid in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Consider Architecture-Specific Builds:** Continue providing separate builds for different architectures (Apple Silicon vs. Intel) to avoid installation and launch problems for users on specific devices.
**Review Conversation Title Saving:** Address the issue of conversation titles saving too eagerly in the Desktop App to improve the user experience.
**Investigate Linux-Specific Issues:** Address the reported freezing issue on Linux Mint and investigate any other Linux-specific problems to ensure a consistent experience across platforms.
